description: Improve the re-rendering of this component.

/shared/Instructions.html.code:
Optimize React Re-renders

Switching from light to dark mode is re-rendering the expensive component.

You can see this is happening by toggling the theme switch and seeing that the component is calculating a new Fibbonaci number.

Our front-end really can't afford that. We need you to fix this application so that clicking the theme switch does not rerender the expensive component.

Good Luck!

title: Optimize React Rerenders

description: Can you fix the bug in the redux code?

/shared/Instructions.html.code:
Redux Bug Hunt

This is a redux application for a simple todo list.

Users are currently able to create a task but when they try to delete a task it doesn't work.

Can you fix the bug?

title: Redux Bug Hunt

/shared/Instructions.html.code:
Outlet

If you use react, you probably use react-router.

A crucial skill to have is the ability to keep a base navigation frame and render different components within that frame.

That is the requirement for this workout.

Good luck!

/Instructions.jsx.code:
// Instructions.jsx

import React from 'react'
import {createRoot} from 'react-dom/client'
import Markdown from 'react-markdown'
    
const markdown = `
# Outlet 
### This challenge will exercise your abilities with react router dom. 
Create a basic navigation system.
There should be 3 pages that can be navigated to. 
1. Create a top navbar containing 3 links.
2. The first link routes to / and renders 'WELCOME'.
3. The second link routes to /about and render "ABOUT" 
4. The third link routes to /info and renders "INFO"
`
  
const root = createRoot(document.getElementById("root"))
root.render(<Markdown>{markdown}</Markdown>)

description: A classic question. Build out multiple tabs.

/shared/Instructions.html.code:
Tabs

Build out basic tabs.

This workout will exercise your abilites with react state.

Good luck!

title: Tabs

description: Fetch data and render the result.

/shared/Instructions.html.code:
Age Api

https://api.agify.io/?name=${text}

This api takes in a name and returns an age.

Your job is to build a form that takes a name as an input and a submit button.

The name in the form should be sent in a request to the provided endpoint.

You should then display the returned age to the user.

Good luck!

title: Age API

description: Test your CSS by building a switch component.

/shared/Instructions.html.code:
Switch

Build a simple switch component.

For me, it wasn't so simple.

Good luck!

title: Switch

description: Implement the most common sorting algorithms.

/shared/Instructions.html.code:
Sorting Algorithm Challenge

Welcome to the Sorting Algorithm Challenge! Your job is to implement a function for each sorting algorithm below. Clicking on the buttons above the table on the main page should properly sort the items in the table by id.

Write the algorithm for each sorting method in the proper file in /src/{name}.

Sorting Algorithms

  • Bubble Sort
  • Insertion Sort
  • Selection Sort
  • Merge Sort
  • QuickSort
  • Shell Sort
  • Heap Sort
Remember: Sort by id!

Good luck!

/index.html.code:
Products:

ID Name Price Popularity Rating

Products:

ID Name Price Popularity Rating

title: Sorting Algorithms

/shared/Instructions.html.code:
Multi-Step Form

Build a three step form. Each form should have the appropriate buttons below it. (next, previous, submit).

The first form should have fields for First Name and Last Name.

The second form should have fields for City and Zip Code.

The third form should have fields for Favorite Food and Favorite dog.

Pressing submit should console all inputed form values.

Good Luck!

description: Like the transfer list, but only swap odd items.

/shared/Instructions.html.code:
Swap Odds

Build two lists with a button in-between them.

Upon clicking the button, the odds items from the left list should swap places with the odd items from the right list.

Good luck!

title: Swap Odds

/shared/Instructions.html.code:
Tic-Tac-Toe

I was given this question when I interviewed for a Mid/Senior role. Seems easy right? I don't think so...

Requirements

  1. The board should be of variable but equal length and height (n).
  2. A win means n consecutive characters (horizontal, diagnol or vertical).
  3. After a win, notify the player of the winner and provide the option to play again.

description: Transfer items from one list to the other.

/shared/Instructions.html.code:
Transfer List

Build two lists with two buttons in-between them.

One button shows a > and the other a <.

The first list should initially be populated with all the items from the provided data. Each item should be prefixed with a checkbox input.

Upon clicking the > button, all checked items from the left list are transfered to the right list.

Upon clicking the < button, all checked items from the right list are transfered to the left list.

Good luck!

title: Transfer List

/shared/Instructions.html.code:
Build a Form

Although it might seem simple, a form is a great way of understanding a developers abilities.

But don't forget about validation, error handling and more..

Good luck!

description: Good luck. This will take a while.

/shared/Instructions.html.code:
The Checked Tree

I was asked to build this component at a previous job.

Words don't do this explanation justice. Check out the introduction of the video to get an idea of what needs to be built.

/data.js.code:
const response = [
  { id: 4, parentId: 3, name: 'Days' },
  { id: 1, parentId: null, name: 'Years' },
  { id: 2, parentId: 1, name: 'Months' },
  { id: 5, parentId: null, name: 'Stars' },
  { id: 3, parentId: 2, name: 'Weeks' },
  { id: 6, parentId: 5, name: 'Sun' },
  { id: 7, parentId: 5, name: 'Proxima Centauri' },
  { id: 8, parentId: null, name: 'Dogs' },
]

export default response

const response = [
  { id: 4, parentId: 3, name: 'Days' },
  { id: 1, parentId: null, name: 'Years' },
  { id: 2, parentId: 1, name: 'Months' },
  { id: 5, parentId: null, name: 'Stars' },
  { id: 3, parentId: 2, name: 'Weeks' },
  { id: 6, parentId: 5, name: 'Sun' },
  { id: 7, parentId: 5, name: 'Proxima Centauri' },
  { id: 8, parentId: null, name: 'Dogs' },
]

export default response

title: Checked Tree

description: Fetch, render, sort, filter. This ones tough.

/shared/Instructions.html.code:
Build A Table

I built an enpoint - https://data.webdevinterviews.com/dogBreeds.json

This endpoint returns an array of data.

Fetch this data and render it into a table.

You then need to complete the following tasks:

  1. Add a working search bar.
  2. Add sorting for all columns.
  3. Add filtering for all columns.

Good luck!

title: Build a table with functionality.
